name: Vernato
description:
Vernato is an AI-powered pronunciation improvement platform helping learners speak with clarity and confidence. Our PronScore™ model combines accuracy, fluency, and completeness into a single score, giving users actionable feedback that actually drives progress.
Built at the intersection of language learning and technology, Vernato is designed for individuals, educators, and organizations seeking a smarter way to master spoken language. We’re on a mission to make effective pronunciation training accessible, measurable, and engaging worldwide.
keyFeatures: PronScore™ model for comprehensive feedback
Actionable insights on accuracy, fluency, and completeness
Designed for individuals, educators, and organizations
Engaging and measurable pronunciation training
techStack: TypeScript, React, Next.js, Azure, Google Cloud, Firebase, Vercel, Tailwind CSS
outcomes:
Successfully developed and deployed a an AI model for pronunciation scoring.
The platform is currently in beta with a select group of users, gathering feedback to refine the learning experience and prepare for a public launch.

name: EMTY
description:
As part of the Entrepreneurship and App Design course at the STEM Institute at City College of New York, I designed an app named EMTY for NYC’s Department of Transportation. EMTY provides real-time data on individual subway car passenger loads, helping to improve commuter flow and convenience. I plan to pitch EMTY to Rep. Espaillat as part of the 2025 Congressional App Challenge.
Additionally, I earned a Gold Award in this course for our research poster, which highlighted how real-time data on passenger loads and waiting times can enhance the commuting experience.
keyFeatures: Live visualization of subway car occupancy data
Designed UX in Figma for intuitive data display
Secure real-time backend with Firebase
Pitched to the U.S. Capitol and Congressman's office
outcomes: Designed a high-fidelity prototype praised for its clarity and user-centric approach. The prototype was used to secure stakeholder buy-in for a full-scale development project. For more details, visit linktr.ee/emty7.

name: Simplify Me.
tagline: Understand Terms of Service in Plain English.
description:
You know when you sign up for a new website or download a shiny new app, and you’re hit with a wall of text that seems to go on forever? Yeah, that’s the Terms of Service. It’s like reading a novel written in legal jargon, and honestly, who has time for that?
Our mission is simple: to help you make informed decisions about your privacy. We’ll give you the key details you need to know, like what data is being collected, how it’s used, and who it’s shared with. Please be informed that we are based on the ToS;DR infrastructure and it abides their Terms of Service. Go check it out for yourself. Trust us, it ain’t too long.
keyFeatures: Translates complex legal jargon into plain English
Summarizes key data collection and privacy policies
Highlights how your data is used and shared
Powered by the ToS;DR community-driven infrastructure
techStack: JavaScript, PHP, WordPress, Zapier, Google Gemini, CSS, HTML
outcomes:
Empowered thousands of users to make more informed decisions about their digital privacy.
The project has been recognized for its user-centric approach to data transparency and has contributed to the broader conversation about online privacy rights.

name: Simply
description:
Simply is an advanced Discord AI bot designed to decode the complexities of Privacy Policies and Terms of Service. Leveraging the power of Google Gemini, Simply streamlines the interpretation of legal documents by providing precise and easily understandable summaries.
This project is a core component of the Simplify Me. ecosystem. Although the bot is no longer active on Discord, its powerful summarization engine can be accessed at simplifyme.org. *Credit for the foundational codebase goes to Echoshard on GitHub (github.com/Echoshard/Gemini_Discordbot).*
keyFeatures: Multi-Format Support: Processes various file types, including images, PDFs, and text files.
Contextual Analysis: Maintains a history window of up to 15 previous messages for coherent conversations.
Privacy Control: Users can reset and clear their message history at any time.
Performance and Scalability: Runs on Python in an Amazon EC2 instance for reliable performance.
High-Accuracy Summaries: Extensively trained on legal texts to handle documents up to 70,000 words.
techStack: Python, AWS, Google Gemini, Discord API
outcomes:
Successfully developed and deployed a Discord bot capable of simplifying complex legal documents, demonstrating skills in AI integration, API usage, and cloud deployment.
The technology now powers the core summarization features of the Simplify Me. web platform.

name: RVC UI & Songs
description:
Retrieval Based Voice Conversion (RVC) is a technique used in speech processing where a system learns to transform one speaker's voice into another's by retrieving similar-sounding samples from a large database.
After seeing AI-generated songs and covers gaining popularity on social media, I embarked on an exciting journey to create samples where the renowned Hindi singer Arijit Singh could sing various songs beyond his originals. To achieve this, I leveraged preexisting datasets trained between 1200–2000 epochs. This entire project was run locally on my Windows machine using Python and its powerful libraries. Additionally, I trained the model with a dataset of my own voice to better understand the challenges of RVC and dataset creation.
keyFeatures: Utilized Retrieval-Based Voice Conversion (RVC) for voice transformation.
Leveraged pre-trained models to generate AI song covers.
Created a custom voice dataset to experiment with model training.
Hands-on experience with local AI model implementation.
outcomes:
Successfully produced high-quality AI-generated song samples, demonstrating a practical understanding of voice conversion technologies.
This project provided deep insights into the nuances of AI model training, dataset management, and the creative potential of generative AI in music.

name: CIFAR-10 CNN Object Classification Model
tagline: Deep Learning for Image Recognition with Veritas AI
description:
As an AI Scholar at Veritas AI, I led the development of our group's capstone project. We used the CIFAR-10 dataset for object and image detection by building and customizing a convolutional neural network (CNN).
This project was completed under the expert mentorship of Jason Jabour, a Computer Science PhD candidate at Harvard University.
keyFeatures: Custom Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) architecture
Trained on the CIFAR-10 dataset for object recognition
Led a group capstone project as a Veritas AI Scholar
Mentored by a Harvard PhD candidate in Computer Science
outcomes: Developed a high-accuracy object classification model and presented the findings, methodology, and results in a comprehensive presentation.
